item.title: Manager, Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Data Analytics Manager will assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. 

What will you do?

  • Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.
  • Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). 
  • Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. 
  • Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. 
  • Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit.
  • Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.
  • Create and maintain foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Support the prioritization of analytics based on areas of best return; deciding on accept/decline analytics and automation activities for the Lab to execute on; hosting regular cadence with lab stakeholders; ensuring analytics initiatives are tracked in central repository.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors
  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.
  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team and global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis
  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors

What do you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s Degree; Masters or Advanced Degree preferred
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Proficient in auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • A strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Strong knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Expert data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • 2+ years of experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: Ability to explain complex Audit and Technological concepts to various stakeholders ranging from Specialists to Executives
  • Strong aptitude for Collaboration, Stakeholder Management and Relationship Management
  • Domain Knowledge and capacity to research and effectively understand innovative concepts, including but not limited to Emerging Financial Risk and Regulation, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, UX/UI, and Data Visualization

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $110,000 - $190,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

  • Drives RBC’s high performance culture
  • Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
  • Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-16-08:00

Application Deadline:

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

item.title: Senior Manager, Pricing Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Pricing Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Home Equity Financing (HEF) is the leading lender of residential mortgages in Canada, and RBC’s single largest business with over $300 Billion in assets. 

As the Senior Manager, Data Analytics within HEF Pricing Team, you will use advanced analytics to provide senior leadership insights into the impacts of pricing strategies and will make recommendations on strategy enhancements.  You will also be responsible for ongoing monitoring on mortgage pricing competitive landscape, providing key insights to leadership and stakeholders.

What will you do?

  • Conduct research and produce weekly reporting package on mortgage pricing competitive landscape to Senior Executives. Provide updates on major competitors’ mortgage rates, cost of funds as well as insights on micro and macro-economic factors that are driving mortgage rate trends.
  • Develop reporting and provide insights on the effectiveness of pricing initiatives for various products, segments and programs within the HEF portfolio on a timely basis; present to HEF leadership and partners.
  • Enhance reporting package that measures the effectiveness of customized pricing strategies. Proactively identify opportunities to improve pricing strategies in order to drive balance growth or incremental revenue.
  • Enhance and update monthly reporting package for HEF Pricing, provide insights on pricing trends and sales practices and their impact on portfolio spreads. 
  • Monitor the use of delegated pricing authorities to ensure compliance.
  • Design and improve processes to reduce the manual effort involved in production of analytics and reports.   Seek out opportunities to build re-usable or automated processes for reporting tasks to enable efficient delivery of insights.   
  • Research new technology and convert existing legacy code in order to improve analytical and reporting activity.
  • Provide ongoing mentoring and coaching to colleagues within HEF Pricing team.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • 4 years of experience in an analytical and reporting capacity supporting a line of business across major Financial Institution(s).  
  • Undergraduate or graduate degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and produce simple, concise presentations to clearly communicate to senior leadership
  • Strong proficiency in SQL, SAS, Python and Tableau (or other data visualization tools).
  • Self-starter—ability to work and think through problems and assignments in a self-directed manner.
  • Excellent communication skills along with ability to partner effectively with and direct both internal and external partners.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience working in mortgage industry
  • Experience with RBC database and mortgage data 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Analyst, Client Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analyst, Client Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Client Data Analytics is part of the Controls & Governance team of the Client & Data Management Group (C&DMG), provides monitoring and performance analysis for the all aspects of client onboarding and refresh activities. The analyst works with stakeholders to produce metrics for effective monitoring, timely reporting and identification of action plans around KPIs and KRIs.

What will you do?

  • Support the delivery of business analytics

  • Ensure data is consistently maintained to agreed operational and regulatory standards throughout the client lifecycle.

  • Help maintain & monitor an inventory of data & key controls showing ownership,
    frequency and SLA’s across the client lifecycle.

  • Support the development of actionable ongoing management reporting that is focused on trends and includes proactive identification and reporting of emerging risks (KPIs and KRIs).

  • Monitor the metrics from the risk and control framework and ensure that the ongoing health of the processes are monitored

  • Ensure sustainable remedial action when issues are identified.

  • Proactively identify operational risks/control deficiencies in the business and opportunities to improve the team & client experience.

  • Collaborate to create processes and monitoring tools, following a risk based approach including appropriate exception management and escalation policies.

  • Support ongoing reporting that is focused on trends and emerging risks
    from different sources of information across business units.

  • Support the creation of a consolidated view of risk and performance, including initiatives, compliance deficiencies and corrective action.

What you need to succeed?

  • Undergraduate degree

  • 2 - 3+ years of Capital Markets experience

  • Quantitative analytic skills, including experience with data analysis and data presentation

  • Strong database experience and GUI development experience

  • Expertise in one or more of Python, VBA, and Tableau

  • MS Office, with particular expertise in Excel and PowerPoint

  • Superior verbal & written communication skills

  • Superior analytical & problem solving skills

  • Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity in a difficult/stressful work environment

  • Demonstrated knowledge & experience with risk and quality control frameworks

  • Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration

Nice-to-haves

  • Formal qualifications as Graduate or Post-Graduate Level.

  • Knowledge of products and operations of Capital Markets, Investment Banking

  • Creative thought process and ability to innovate

  • Attention to detail while working with high volume of data and transactions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

Address:

HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, Canada

City:

CAN-NS-BEDFORD

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Application Deadline:

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Sr. Manager, Portfolio Monitoring Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Portfolio Monitoring Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Sr. Manager, Portfolio Monitoring Analytics, you support the Director in achieving the business objectives, strategic priorities and operational effectiveness goals of Business Credit and the Portfolio Monitoring team. You are responsible in providing MIS and analytics support to help ensure appropriate oversight and monitoring of the Business Credit portfolio and Field compliance activities and to support strategic initiatives and special projects.

What will you do?

• Use your strong analytical capabilities and ability to clearly formulate/articulate findings to stakeholders and senior management

• Apply understanding of Business Credit and Portfolio Monitoring processes to develop data requirements, gather and analyze reporting requirements, and determine the best data sources

• Support strategic initiatives and specialized reporting through data sourcing, manipulation, analysis, visualizations, reporting and value-added insights, developing tool and BI solutions

• Provide support to develop and continuously improve Portfolio Monitoring Reporting infrastructure for Business Credit and identify/recommend ways to simplify and automate processes

• Enhance Business Credit client information capabilities and develop and analytic capabilities through SAS, SQL Server, Tableau and other technology

• Implement robust documentation of Business Credit Portfolio Monitoring Reporting and analytical procedures in a clear and concise manner for audit and regulatory purposes

What will you need to succeed?

Must-have

• 5-10 years of work experience in the financial services industry as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience with large relational databases

• Undergraduate or graduate degree in Business, Mathematics, or related fields

• Advanced SAS (including base SAS) and SQL programming

• Strong proficiency in Tableau and advanced data visualization skills, including dashboard design, optimization and advanced calculated fields (Tableau Qualified Associate or above preferred); Strong understanding of Tableau Server, including setting up groups, folders, setting up permissions

• Analytical mindset and excellent communication and presentations skills with proven ability to communicate effectively and build strong relationships through a collaborative and consultative approach

• Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision with good organizational awareness and strong execution excellence

Nice-to-have

• Knowledge of Small Business and Commercial Credits and Risks

• Experience with SQL Server and Teradata/Data Lake infrastructures

What\'s in it for you?

• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

• Flexible work/life balance options

• Sophisticated RBCI software tools to boost your productivity

Job Summary

Manages financial and administrative support functions and day-to-day activities to ensure financial objectives are fully achieved. Typically manages 2 or more specialized departments comprised of supervisors, managers, professionals, and/or large numbers of operational support employees.

Address:

MISSISSAUGA, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-MISSISSAUGA

Country:

Canada

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Salaried

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Director, Consumer Portfolio Management and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Consumer Portfolio Management and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, the Director will report to the Sr. Director, Consumer Portfolio Management and Analytics, and will be accountable for managing the credit quality of the Canadian consumer lending portfolios across the credit value chain. 

The incumbent identifies trends, develops insights and makes recommendations on performance and loss forecast through interpretation of interplays between portfolio performance, macro economic trends and business strategy.

The incumbent understands and strives for optimal risk-reward balance through any economic cycle, accepts responsibility for the analyses towards optimal performance of the respective portfolios and ensures alignment of shareholders, clients and employee interests. 

This position specializes in insight- and foresight-generation through in-depth portfolio analytics and requires the incumbent to have equally strong business, analytical and communication skills. Successful credit risk management is built on these strengths: cross-enterprise mindset, understanding of consumer behaviour and RBC risk appetite, and adaptability to the dynamic credit environment.

What will you do?

(a) Portfolio Management

  • Provide concise, insightful and timely analytics of key Consumer portfolio credit risk trends through interpretation of interplays between portfolio performance, macro economic trends and business strategy.
  • Monitor and communicate internal and external developments that may impact risk (e.g. regulatory changes, macro economic factors, changes in the accumulation, usage and composition of consumer debt, issues arising from client or employee feedback, organizational restructure)
  • Leverage understanding of RBC’s risk appetite and overall risk management position to ensure PCL level and product-client risk profiles optimize portfolio profitability through the economic cycle
  • Support business growth targets while ensuring appropriate risk mitigation strategies are in place, maintaining overall portfolio quality
  • Spot changing risk patterns and identify portfolio vulnerabilities and opportunities, quantify them and present recommendations for optimization

(b) Provision for Credit Losses under IFRS 9

  • Lead the fulsome quarterly IFRS 9 PCL results analysis, working closely with GRM and Enterprise Risk, and manage to approved targets for Home Equity and Personal Lending (Direct and Indirect), and Cards.
  • Lead the quarterly forecasting and annual planning process including the coverage ratio and time value of money analysis  
  • Identify key trends and emerging risks/opportunities, review forward looking economic indicators and potential stress events

(c) Strategic initiatives

  • Lead deep dives into credit trends that span all credit products, such as Debt to Income Analysis.
  • Establish and implement a reporting process that will enable effective credit risk management oversight of the portfolio segments
  • Lead cross-functional teams through the analytics process to make sound information-based decisions and develop robust risk management measures to effectively identify, mitigate and monitor risks
  • Represent PM&CS at strategic initiatives that impact consumer credit as a whole participate in cross-functional projects as subject matter expert in consumer credit risk

(d) Data stewardship and self-serve reporting tools

  • Act as data steward
  • Lead and maintain ownership for defining concise, standard and shareable credit risk metrics and dimensions to be used by PM&CS and other areas of RBC; gathering and documenting business and technical requirements for self-serve reporting tools; providing subject matter expertise to user community

(e) People Management

  • Develop and manage a team of 3 highly-specialized senior managers/managers  

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Undergraduate degree in business, economics, mathematics, statistics, computer science or other quantitative discipline
  • In-depth knowledge of Canadian consumer credit products, policies and procedures
  • Strong leadership and relationship management competencies (proven ability to lead cross-functional and project teams)
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically and integrate information from multiple sources
  • Strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Strong knowledge of data, analytics and reporting tools such as SAS, python, and Tableau

Nice to have:

  • Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Coordinates and supports a Global Risk Monitoring/Reporting team to develop and implement regional risk management reports, systems, and processes. Manages activities through senior managers and managers and implements corporate and divisional strategic plans and budgets.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-09-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-18-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Senior Consultant, BI Solutions and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Consultant, BI Solutions and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will be working within Investor &Treasury Services (I&TS) and closely collaborating with the teams principally focused on the data and analytics initiatives. We’re at the center of everything Data and Digital. We’re building a team that embraces innovation & enthusiasm to bring fresh perspectives. We’ve been on a journey to build out high performing, highly resilient data and BI solutions that’s scalable with the continuous demands from Internal and External stakeholders.

We’re looking for talented and passionate Business Intelligence (BI) & Analytics professionals to join our team! With an analytical mind-set, you will work as part of an agile team to deliver highly scalable solutions built on various technologies. We believe in continuous growth and expanding your capabilities. Join our team today and have a big impact influencing the strength of our Data and Digital capabilities.

What will you do?

Requirements Gathering:

  • Elicit, analyze and document business requirements. Work with relevant stakeholders (Products, Client Experience) and in-house data and digital teams throughout solution building and delivery.
  • A key member of the project team, the Senior Consultant works with Client Digital delivery leads and Developers, Data Domain experts to deliver solutions on time and within budget.

Stakeholder management:

  • Pro-actively communicate and collaborate with internal stakeholders to analyze functional requirements and deliver the appropriate artefacts as needed.
  • Act as the first line of contact to interface with internal stakeholders – Operations team, Client Success team, Data Engineering team and others.

Business Analytics:

  • Review data to ensure its integrity for data analysis to deliver business insights and validation of hypothesis
  • Build compelling and Power BI reports/dashboards and translate findings into executive communications
  • Demonstrable ability to analyze data/trends, interpret results, build KPIs, explain KPI drivers and communicate in simple terms

Technical know-how:

  • In-depth knowledge of database systems such as relational databases, OLAP, Kimble methodologies,
  • Strong understanding of ETL processes and data modelling processes
  • Hands-on experience of visualization software such as Power BI

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • 2-4 years of experience in business intelligence and analytics field with strong understanding of technical aspects while working with the business on value driven analysis
  • Strong business communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Advanced problem-solving skills

Nice to Have:

  • Strong knowledge of fundamental data concepts (for example, but not limited to groups, hierarchies, data structures).
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Investor and Treasury Services

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-01-04-08:00

2023-01-18-08:00

We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics will monitor market risk and implement risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. This role will support the Director, E&S Risk – Climate Methodologies to undertake data analysis and explore the use of climate methodologies; work with others in the team to access and analyze climate relevant data internally and externally; visualize results of climate measurement work through dashboards and presentations; contribute to the cleaning and maintenance of data standards and the translation of climate measurement outputs into risk relevant data and business insights.

What will you do?

  • Play a key supporting role as part of the team that is working to meet RBC’s net zero by 2050 commitment and NZBA commitment to set interim reduction targets for high emitting sectors by conducting data analysis and working with climate methodologies
  • Undertake data analysis work that will contribute to RBC’s ability to stay aligned to its published climate commitments and work as part of a team to further develop E&S risk measurement capabilities and contribute to E&S risk integration and disclosure
  • As part of a team, work to develop RBC’s capabilities in transition and physical risk data analysis and collaborate with other RBC groups both within GRM globally and across the enterprise in respect of climate measurement for risk management and business strategy  
  • Support climate data work to meet regulatory requirements as these develop

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages (e.g. SQL, python)
  • Thorough understanding of data quality, application of data quality tests, and its impact on analytics
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights.
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives (e.g. PowerPoint, Tableau) and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Comfort working in an evolving fast-paced environment
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, highly collaborative.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Knowledge of ESG data landscape: common challenges and available solutions
  • Knowledge of controls and process documentation
  • Risk management experience particularly in relation to climate risk is a nice to have

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Monitors market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

item.title: Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics, you will report to the Director, Portfolio Mgmt and Analytics. The Senior Manager will have full ownership of Stage 3 Provision for Credit Losses (PCL) portfolio analytics for the retail Credit Cards portfolio, identify trends, develop insights and new methods to assess PCL per evolving regulatory requirements, and make recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecasting.

This role gives the incumbent the opportunity to build on these strengths: cross-enterprise mindset, understanding of consumer behavior and RBC risk appetite, and adaptability to the dynamic credit environment. This position specializes in insight-generation through in-depth portfolio analytics with a focus on Stage 3 PCL.

What will you do?

  • Lead reviews around Stage 3 PCL portfolio analytics for Cards and identify trends that support recommendations on PCL mid-month and month end estimates sent to P&CB and GRM Senior Management, Five Year Outlook, Annual Plan and quarterly forecast.
  • Lead deep dive analytics and provide early warning indicators to facilitate recommendations for areas of concern to highlight to executives.
  • Develop enhanced monthly dashboard that provides transparency on Stage 3 PCL performance for increased awareness of senior leadership around the largest portfolio within Canadian banking balance sheet.   
  • Lead, as subject matter expert, in all manner of data mining activities towards PCL applications (activities include, but are not limited to: data analysis, aggregation, interpretation, and recommendation).
  • Lead preparation of Executive level presentation for PMCS, GRM and Sr. Management and Investor Relations which provides an early quarterly view of emerging Cards credit risk profile.
  • Assist Sr. Director, Portfolio Management & Analytics in preparing Executive level presentations for VP PMCS to present at P&CB Operating Committee’s Credit Risk Update.
  • Support action plans through to implementation
  • Develop and execute routines to measure and monitor effectiveness of policy and process changes to determine success and make adjustment recommendations where required
  • Support PM&CS initiatives, analytics, and adhoc requests as required

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in Economics, Statistics or other quantitative field of study
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written)
  • 5+ years related work experience with SQL, SAS or equivalent programming experience, and proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint
  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment
  • Proven analytical skills
  • Strong understanding of consumer behavior and credit risk
  • Proven ability to connect process, policy, system, and data together and establish impact when any of the above changes
  • Collaborative and supportive attitude
  • Creative thinker to solve complex problems
  • Ability to impact and influence is critical as this is a leadership position

Nice-to-have    

  • Knowledge of Teradata, DB2, Oracle, Tableau, Python
  • Working knowledge of Personal Financing Products.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities      
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Job Summary

The Senior Manager will have full ownership of Stage 3 Provision for Credit Losses (PCL) portfolio analytics for the retail Credit Cards portfolio, identify trends, develop insights and new methods to assess PCL per evolving regulatory requirements, and make recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecasting.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Regular

Salaried

2022-12-12-08:00
